wikipedia_page.main:
Thomas Colcott Fox (13 June 1849 – 11 April 1916) was an English first-class cricketer. A right-handed batsman, he made his first-class debut for Hampshire in 1875, where he made two County Championship appearances for the club against Kent and Sussex.
He was later a prominent dermatologist. The standard author abbreviation Fox is used to indicate this person as the author when citing a botanical name.Fox died in Westminster, London on 11 April 1916.

response: * Thomas Fox (1622–1666), English MP for Tamworth 1660–1661
*Thomas Fox (Leicester MP), represented Leicester (UK Parliament constituency)
* Thomas Fox (cricketer, born 1849) (1849–1916), English cricketer and botanist
* Thomas Fox (rower) (1928–2010), Guernsey-born doctor and rower
* Tinker Fox (1610–1650), Colonel John Fox, English Parliamentarian Soldier, erroneously referred to as Thomas Fox by some sources
*Thomas Fox, cricketer, was born in Broughton
